intro: Hieracium subsvaneticum, commonly known as the Subsvanetic Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are generally hairy and serrated. Hieracium subsvaneticum is often found in temperate regions and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich soils.
